Class Graph

java.lang.Object
Graph
public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
The Graph program implements a Java graph class for representing simple, unweighted graphs. Vertices have fields for "parent" and "mark", making it straightforward to implement algorithms such as DFS and BFS.
Since:
2-17-2020

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Graph()
    Graph constructor for an empty graph.
    Graph​(int n)
    Graph constructor with one argument, builds an edgeless graph with labels "0", "1", "2", ...
    Graph​(java.lang.String V)
    Graph constructor with one argument, builds an edgeless graph with provided characters as labels.

  • Constructor Details

    • Graph

      public Graph()
      Graph constructor for an empty graph.

    • Graph

      public Graph​(java.lang.String V)
      Graph constructor with one argument, builds an edgeless graph with provided characters as labels.
      Parameters:
      V - A string. Its individual characters will become the vertex labels. It is assumed that V has no repeated characters.

    • Graph

      public Graph​(int n)
      Graph constructor with one argument, builds an edgeless graph with labels "0", "1", "2", ...
      Parameters:
      n - an integer, the order (number of vertices) of the new graph

  • Method Details

    • completeGraph

      public static Graph completeGraph​(int n)
      Makes the complete graph of a specified order, vertex labels are characters.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of vertices to include in the graph; it is assumed that 1 <= n <= 26
      Returns:
      the complete graph on n vertices, using abcd...xyz as possible vertex labels.

    • cycleGraph

      public static Graph cycleGraph​(int n)
      Makes the cycle graph of a specified order.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of vertices to include in the graph; it is assumed that 3 <= n <= 26, but if n < 3 then a 3-cycle is made.
      Returns:
      the cycle graph on n vertices, using abcd...xyz as possible vertex labels.

    • twoCycleGraph

      public static Graph twoCycleGraph​(int m, int n)
      Makes a disconnected graph whose components are an m-cycle and an n-cycle.
      Parameters:
      m - an integer with 3 <= m
      n - an integer with 3 <= n
      Returns:
      the graph Cm + Cn

    • pathGraph

      public static Graph pathGraph​(int n)
      Makes the path graph of a specified order.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of vertices to include in the graph; it is assumed that 1 <= n <= 26.
      Returns:
      the path graph on n vertices, using abcd...xyz as possible vertex labels.

    • completeBipartiteGraph

      public static Graph completeBipartiteGraph​(int m, int n)
      Makes the complete bipartite graph K(m, n) where 1 <= m, 1 <= n, and m + n <= 26. The "X" vertices are the first m-many vertices; they each have degree n and have every "Y" vertex as neighbors. The "Y" vertices are the last n-many vertices; they each have degree m and have every "X" vertex as neighbors.
      Parameters:
      m - the number of "X" vertices
      n - the number of "Y" vertices
      Returns:
      the complete bipartite graph K(m, n)

    • order

      public int order()
      Returns the order of the graph, that is, the number of vertices it has.
      Returns:
      number of vertices in the graph

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the size of the graph, that is, the number of edges it has.
      Returns:
      number of edges in the graph

    • getVertexWithLabel

      public Vertex getVertexWithLabel​(java.lang.String myLabel)
      Returns the vertex with a given label.
      Parameters:
      myLabel - the label
      Returns:
      the vertex with the given label, or null if not found in the vertex list

    • isVertex

      public boolean isVertex​(java.lang.String theLabel)
      Checks whether a given String is the label of a vertex in this graph.
      Parameters:
      theLabel - a String, potential vertex label
      Returns:
      true if theLabel corresponds to an actual vertex in this graph, false otherwise

    • addVertex

      public void addVertex​(java.lang.String newLabel)
      Adds a new vertex to the graph, if it's not already there.
      Parameters:
      newLabel - a String, the label for the new vertex

    • isEdge

      public boolean isEdge​(java.lang.String endpt1, java.lang.String endpt2)
      Checks for the presence of an edge between two vertices in this graph.
      Parameters:
      endpt1 - Label of the first endpoint.
      endpt2 - Label of the second endpoint.
      Returns:
      true if the two vertices are in the vertex set and are adjacent, false otherwise.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(java.lang.String endpt1, java.lang.String endpt2)
      Adds a new edge to the graph, if the edge does not already exist. This can be a new edge between existing vertices, a new edge between an existing vertex and a new vertex, or an edge between two new vertices. If the edge already exists, no change is made to the graph.
      Parameters:
      endpt1 - Label of the first endpoint.
      endpt2 - Label of the second endpoint.

    • removeEdge

      public void removeEdge​(java.lang.String endpt1, java.lang.String endpt2)
      Removes an edge from the graph, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      endpt1 - Label of the first endpoint.
      endpt2 - Label of the second endpoint.

    • getVertexSet

      public java.util.Collection<Vertex> getVertexSet()
      Returns the vertex set.
      Returns:
      The set of vertices in this graph.

    • resetVertexMarks

      public void resetVertexMarks()
      Sets all the vertex marks back to zero.

    • resetVertexParents

      public void resetVertexParents()
      Sets all the vertex parents back to null.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string for printing the graph's information.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string reporting the graph's vertices and adjacency lists.

    • DFS

      public void DFS​(boolean printReport)
      Performs a depth-first traversal of the graph, as in Levitin p.123. The vertex label, along with its count and its parent vertex (if any) is printed when the vertex is visited. Note: If DFS is being used as a helper for some other method, call it with printReport=false.
      Parameters:
      printReport - boolean value determines whether a report on the DFS traversal will be printed

    • countComponents

      public int countComponents()
      Uses a call to DFS to help count the number of components in the graph. Note: The number of vertices in the depth-first traversal which have no parent vertex equals the number of components in the graph; just need to count the number of parent-less vertices after DFS has been called.
      Returns:
      an integer, the number of components in the graph

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Determines (efficiently) whether or not the graph is connected. Note1: This is a modification of DFS/dfs. Note2: As soon as a second component is detected, the method stops and returns false; it does not waste time continuing to explore the graph.

    • markComponents

      public void markComponents​(boolean printReport)
      Determines the component number for each vertex. (Each vertex mark is set to indicate its component number.) If called with printReport=true, the report prints one line for each vertex along with its component number and the label of its parent vertex (or "none" if no parent). Note1: This is a modification of DFS/dfs. Note2: If the graph is connected then all its vertices are in component 1.
      Parameters:
      printReport - boolean value determines whether a report will be printed

    • findBackEdge

      public Vertex[] findBackEdge()
      Returns an array of two adjacent vertices (an "edge") representing a back edge. Note: This is a modification of DFS/dfs.

    • findCycle

      public Cycle findCycle()
      Returns a cycle in the graph, or returns null if the graph is acyclic. Note1: This is a modification of findBackEdge/back_edge_helper. Note2: Need to locate a back edge in the DFS traversal, then use the vertices' parent information to determine a specific cycle which includes that back edge.
      Returns:
      a Cycle in the graph, or null if the graph is acyclic

    • isTree

      public boolean isTree()
      Determines whether this graph is a tree (connected and acyclic). Note: This implementation should be no more than three lines and as efficient as possible.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
